Restoration Shaman Mythic+ Guide

11.1 - Undermine(d)

Last Updated:February 25, 2025|Changelog|FAQ

Welcome to the Restoration Shaman Mythic+ guide for the World of Warcraft patch 11.1! This guide covers everything you need to know to understand your character! Are you starting out and leveling up from 70? Check out the leveling guide!

Hero Talents

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman
  • In a Mythic+ environment
    Totemic     outperforms
    Farseer     in the majority of scenarios, Therefore this guide focuses solely on the better option.
  • Farseer     focuses on Single Target healing and provides a significant single target damage increase compared to
    Totemic    , While
    Totemic     focuses on AoE healing and Cooldown strength.
Totemic
Farseer
  • Surging Totem
    • Summons a totem that maintains
      Healing Rain       around it
    • It is important to think about the placement of the
      Surging Totem       as the duration is 24 seconds, you can always utilize
      Totemic Projection       to move it, including
      Healing Rain
  • Whirling Elements    .
    • Everytime you summon
      Surging Totem       you get 3 different element buffs that affect your next healing abilities.
      • Water - Makes your next Healing Wave or
        Healing Surge         cleave to an ally within your healing rain.
      • Air - Cast time of your next healing spell is reduced by 40%.
      • Earth - Your next
        Chain Heal         will apply
        Earthliving Weapon         to all targets hit.

Call of the Ancestors
Call an ancestor to your side after benefiting from
Undulation or
Unleash Life for a few seconds.
10 Seconds if you benefit from
Undulation
16 Seconds if you benefit from
Unleash Life
When you cast a healing or damage spell, your Ancestor casts a similar spell.
Ancestral Swiftness
This works the same as
Nature's Swiftness, but now making it a lot stronger and plays a big part in the
Farseer playstyle.
After activating the
Ancestral Swiftness, you summon an Ancestor for 10 seconds.

Talents

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman
General

When to use this Spec

This is the default loadout going into any dungeon as it specializes in survivability and strong group healing. You have to adjust the class talent tree based on the utility needed for the affix and dungeon combo. To make your life easier, Dungeon specific talent loadouts are available in the Dungeons section.

Gameplay Altering Talents

Discover all talents that significantly alter your gameplay within the Spec and Class Talent trees. This section gives a concise overview of these talents and their applications but for a more detailed look check out the Rotation and Deep Dive sections below.

Spec Tree

  • Water Totem Mastery
    • Consuming
      Tidal Waves       has a chance to give you cooldown reduction on the majority of your totems. With that known, don't let any
      Tidal Waves       go to waste.
  • Echo of the Elements
    • Riptide       and
      Lava Burst       have an additional charge.
    • Great synergy with
      Water Totem Mastery       to gain more
      Tidal Waves       and therefore more cooldown reduction.
  • Downpour
    • After every
      Healing Rain       you receive 1 use of
      Downpour       which heals and increases maximum health by 10% to 5 allies within
      Healing Rain      .
  • Ancestral Vigor
    • Great talent to provide survivability to you and your party, your core healing spells provide a 10% health increase.
  • Acid Rain
    • Your
      Healing Rain       now deals moderate damage, make sure to place it around the boss, while also healing your melee camp.
  • Earthen Harmony
    • This talent makes
      Earth Shield       a lot stronger. Make sure to have it up on yourself and another ally at all times while specced into
      Elemental Orbit      .
  • Master of the Elements
    • Healing Surge       applies
      Flame Shock       to a nearby enemy when empowered by
      Master of the Elements      , making it easy to maintain
      Flame Shock       without losing important GCDs.
    • Casting
      Lava Burst       also increases the healing done from
      Healing Surge       by 30%, stacking up to 2 times. Which further emphasizes on how strong
      Healing Surge       becomes when all buffs are present.

Class Tree

  • Elemental Orbit
    • You can have
      Earth Shield       on yourself and one ally at the same time. This allows you to focus more on healing others and sustain yourself with passive healing.
  • Nature's Guardian
    • When your health is brought below 35%, you instantly heal for 20% of your maximum health. This effect cannot occur more than once every 45 seconds.
  • Totemic Focus
    • Increases the radius and duration of your totems which gives you an easier time managing totem positioning whenever there's movement.
  • Totemic Surge
    • Reduces the cooldown of your totems by 6 seconds.

Hero Talents

  • Wind Barrier
    • Gives you an absorb shield when you have an active totem, this adds to your survivability
  • Supportive Imbuements
    • New imbue for your shield, you are required to play a shield when you play
      Totemic       as this imbue increases your healing done and the duration of your
      Healing Stream Totem      .
  • Oversized Totems
    • Increases the size and radius of your totems, which can be helpful on fights that require your raid to move or dodge certain mechanics. The more radius you cover the easier it is to ensure you cover everyone in your raid with totems such as
      Spirit Link Totem
  • Lively Totems
    • Your healing totems will cast a free chain heal when summoned, making it easy for you to deal with quick damage intake.

Rotation

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

Tier Set

  • 2-Set: Your healing spells have a chance to apply
    Insurance!     to their targets that heals them over 15 sec.
    Insurance!     is consumed if an ally drops below 40% health to heal them.
  • 4-pc: When you cast
    Healing Rain    , 1 ally will get
    Insurance!    , when
    Insurance!         is consumed you get 10% bonus healing to your
    Chain Heal    ,
    Healing Surge     and
    Healing Wave    .

This set further emphasizes on

Tidal Waves and you have to ensure to always have
Tidal Waves up before using your affected healing spells.

Priority List

For Healing -
Totemic

  1. Cast
    High Tide     buffed
    Chain Heals     if 3+ allies require healing.
  2. Cast
    Surging Totem     on cooldown.
  3. Cast
    Downpour     if your allies are injured.
  4. Cast
    Riptide     on cooldown for
    Tidal Waves    .
  5. Cast 
    Healing Stream Totem     to avoid overcapping on charges.
  6. Cast
    Chain Heal     if 3+ allies are missing health.
  7. Cast
    Healing Wave    .
  8. Refresh
    Earth Shield    .

For Damage

  1. Maintain
    Healing Rain     to make use of
    Acid Rain    .
  2. Cast
    Chain Lightning     if there are 2+ enemies.
  3. Maintain
    Flame Shock    .
  4. Cast
    Lava Burst    .
  5. Cast
    Lightning Bolt    .

Cooldowns

Cloudburst Totem

  • This totem accumulates a portion of your healing while it's up and should nearly always be used on cooldown unless you need to delay its use for specific timing or a damage event.
  • You can read more about
    Cloudburst Totem     in the Deep dive section below.

Ascendance

  • Use
    Ascendance     when your party is dying as it's your strongest healing cooldown as there is a strong intial heal, followed up by duplicating all healing you deal by 70%, split evenly among allies within 40 yards.

Healing Tide Totem

  • This totem is one of your baseline throughput cooldowns and it heals all allies within 40 yards. It's a great cooldown to use when your globals are tight and the HPS requirements are high, or during heavy movement.

Spirit Link Totem

  • This totem is one of the most unique cooldowns in the game with the power to redistribute your allies' health to have the same percentage of maximum health every second. It also grants your allies a 15% damage reduction for whoever is within the radius.
  • Spirit Link Totem     is an extremely powerful cooldown to counter overwhelming damage on your party and also has great synergy with
    Darkness    .

Deep Dive

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

Min maxing
Deluge

  • Deluge     is one of your early Restoration talents and is crucial to consider when you need that extra throughput. Placing a good
    Healing Rain     can save you from spending more globals than necessary while maintaining high uptime of
    Deluge    .
  • If it is not possible to stay stacked for
    Healing Rain    , prioritize to use
    Riptide     on range players to fully utilize
    Deluge    .

Min maxing
Tidal Waves

  • While
    Tidal Waves     is almost always up due to
    Riptide     being a short cooldown spell, it is important to stack up your
    Tidal Waves     before a lethal damage event, allowing you to spam cast your strong healing spells without having to worry about using
    Riptide     in between.
  • It buffs your next
    Healing Wave    ,
    Chain Heal     or
    Healing Surge    .

Min maxing
Call of the Ancestors

  • Your main goal with the Hero Talent
    Farseer    , is to call Ancestors to your side to aid you. In Mythic+, you spend the majority of the dungeon doing damage rather than healing, and all DPS you provide will have a positive impact on the Mythic+ timer.
  • Use
    Unleash Life     and
    Ancestral Swiftness     on cooldown to ensure you don't miss out on the bonus damage they provide.
  • You can play
    Undulation     instead of
    Unleash Life    , but it is not recommended as you would have to constantly overheal your allies to proc Ancestors.

Min maxing
Cloudburst

  • Cloudburst     is one of your strongest tools. Being able to make full use of
    Cloudburst     is extremely important and helps with any throughput issues you might encounter.
  • Before you place
    Cloudburst    , there are a few things you can prepare. Spread out
    Riptide    , placing down
    Healing Rain    , right before
    Cloudburst    .
  • Your
    Cloudburst     also interacts with
    Ascendance    . Both abilities are extremely powerful when combined, and thanks to
    First Ascendant    , they both share the same cooldown of 2 minutes, any extra healing is transferred to your
    Cloudburst    .
  • If you play with
    Healing Stream Totem     instead of
    Cloudburst    , You don't have to think about this at all and should use
    Healing Stream Totem     when someone in your party is injured.

Understanding Mechanics

Rotational min-maxing is just one aspect of mastering a specialization, but there are numerous other key mechanics that influence your performance. Use the following guides to improve them.

  • Pandemic
  • Spell Queue Window
  • Stat Diminishing Returns

Affixes

The Affix system got revamped going into The War Within Season 1 retiring most Affixes as well as introducing new kiss-curse ones while also changing on which key level these appear.

  • +4 Affixes -- Rotates on a weekly basis
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Pulsar
  • +7 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +10 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis, is always the opposite of the +7 Affix
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +12 Affix
    • Xal'atath's Guile       -- Replaces the +4 Affix

Following you get some useful tips for handling different Mythic+ Affixes as a Restoration Shaman.

  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • You can use
      Thunderstorm       and
      Capacitor Totem       for this affix.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Make sure to target this and use your DPS abilities, if no healing is required.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Utilize
      Wind Rush Totem       and
      Spiritwalker's Grace       to make it easier to soak these, without loosing uptime.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • Poison Cleansing Totem       is great for dealing with this affix.

Stat Priority

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

Understand your secondary stat priority and the tertiary stats needed for optimal performance during Mythic+ dungeons as a Restoration Shaman. For more detailed information, visit the Stats and Attributes guide.

The conclusion here is that you want to equip the highest item level generally.

Blizzard introduced Stat DRs that you need to be aware of. To get to know what those are and why you have to care about them click here to get to our detailed stat DR resource post!

Tertiary

  • Avoidance - Reduces damage taken from AoE effects.
  • Leech - Returns a portion of your damage and healing done as healing to you. (Excludes self healing)
  • Speed - increases movement speed. (Does stack with other movement speed abilities)

The only time you should think about picking a lower item level is if it has Leech or Avoidance. Speed is nice to have, but you should generally ignore that stat.

Here is a showcase of how powerful Leech is for a Healer:

Farmable Alternatives

Below you are presented with a good list of farmable alternatives that are obtainable outside of WoWs weekly lockout system. While replaced in time as you progress, these offer immediate character power.

Trinkets

Below you can find active and passive alternatives to our recommended trinkets. Do note that some trinkets are better than others depending on the dungeon.

Active Trinket alternatives

  • Funhouse Lens
    • A delve trinket that is a good on-use alternative at an equal item level.

Passive Trinket alternatives

  • Suspicious Energy Drink
    • Strong stat stick that can proc Mastery after casting harmful spells, farmable through Delves.
  • Mug's Moxie Jug
    • Strong stat stick as well, gives your spells a chance to grant you some Crit that stacks up but doesn't refresh the duration.
  • Reverb Radio
    • Strong stat stick, that gives you a high average of your preferred secondary stat.

Embellishments

  • Duskthread Lining     2x
    • Increases your Versatility by a small amount, while above 80% HP

Remaining Sparks

  • Crafted items are 675 item level and regular items are 678 at max item level, therefore it is not beneficial to equip crafted items outside of your 2x embellishments unless you don't have access to other high item level gear on that slot.

Consumables

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman
  • Phials
    • Flask of Tempered Swiftness       or
      Flask of Tempered Versatility

Enchantments

You buy

Nerubian Gemweaver from the Great Vault Vendor to add sockets to your Helm, Wrists and Belt.

Races

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

For min-maxing a Restoration Shaman in Mythic+ Dungeons, different racial traits can provide a tremendous benefit to your characters. If this is not your top goal, picking a race that fits your style works just as well.

  • Rocket Jump     -- Goblin
    • Do a small jump in the direction your character is facing.
    • While you're in the
      Rocket Jump       animation you are placed on a global cooldown until your character lands.
  • Stoneform     -- Dwarf
    • Removes all magic, bleed, poison, and disease effects and reduces physical damage taken
  • Ancestral Call     -- Mag'har Orc
    • 2 minute cooldown that gives you a high amount of secondary stats.

Recommendation:

It is recommended to play

Dwarf as it is the strongest option for Mythic+ if you are trying to push higher key levels as a Restoration Shaman

Addons

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

Below, you see a screenshot of the author's User Interface for their Restoration Shaman, outlining which addons are used and how they are utilized in Mythic+ Dungeons to make your life easier.

Addons

  • ElvUI -- Party/Raidframe Addon
    • Addon to replace your Unitframes and other UI Elements with a more clean look. Takes quite some time to configure but there are plenty of pre-done profiles that you can easily import and check out.
    • Alternatively, you can also use BetterBlizzFrames if you want to not spend hours configuring this.
  • BigWigs -- BossMods Addon
    • BigWigs is a boss encounter add-on. It consists of many individual encounter scripts, or boss modules; mini add-ons that are designed to trigger alert messages, timer bars, sounds, and so forth, for one specific Raid encounter.
  • WeakAuras -- Jack of all trades
    • WeakAura allows players to create and customize graphical displays of game information. These displays, known as "auras" can show various aspects such as buffs, debuffs, cooldowns, health, and other important events.
  • OmniCD -- Party CD Tracker
    • Addon to track your party members' Cooldowns, mandatory for M+.
  • Details -- Damage Meter
    • Shows you Damage/Healing throughout the dungeon.

WeakAuras

These WeakAuras are recommended for optimal performance in Mythic+ dungeons as a Restoration Shaman.

Cloudburst Totem Tracker

Displays the value of your

Cloudburst Totem

Changes this Patch

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

Patch 11.1

  • SHAMAN
    • Ghost Wolf visuals have been updated to scale with player model, and have been made more transparent to reduce visual clutter.
    • Lightning Bolt has a new spell visual.
    • Ancestral Guidance has been removed.Developers notes: We have a couple goals we are trying to address with this change. One is to reduce the overlap between Ascendance and Ancestral Guidance for Restoration. They both serve a similar purpose and are often combined together. Second, wed like to bolster Enhancement and Elementals off-healing utility from intentional global cooldown usage while pulling back on more passive ways to restore group health.
    • The initial shield from Stone Bulwark Totem is no longer dispellable. The repeating shields will continue to be dispellable.
  • Restoration
    • Developers notes: Our updates to Restoration Shaman are focused on simplification, condensing keybind space, and adding support to Riptide focused builds.
    • New Talent: Mana Tide Healing Tide Totem now additionally grants 80% increased mana regeneration to allies.
    • New Talent: Therazanes Resilience Earth Shield and Water Shield no longer lose charges and are 115% effective.
    • New Talent: Whispering Waves 10% of Healing Waves healing is duplicated onto each of your targets with Riptide.
    • Healing Wave is now learned at level 11 (was a talent).
    • Wavespeakers Blessing now additionally increases the periodic healing of Riptide by 10/20%.
    • Spiritwalkers Tidal Totem now triggers after casting Healing Tide Totem.
    • Downpour now overrides Healing Rain for 8 seconds (was 6 seconds).
      • Developers notes: We are leaving some room for this to expire before the cooldown of Healing Rain or Surging Totem becomes available to avoid having to cancel the buff or wait for it to expire when Downpour is not necessary to cast.
    • The starter build has been updated.
    • Several talents have moved locations.
    • Ancestral Vigor is now a 2-point talent.
    • The following talents have been removed:
      • Healing Wave (now learned at level 11)
      • Mana Tide Totem
      • Primordial Wave
    • All healing increased by 5%.
    • Acid Rain damage increased by 25%.
    • Fixed an issue that caused Therazanes Resilience to not function correctly with external Earth Shields.
      • Developers notes: This baseline healing adjustment is aimed at keeping Restoration Shamans overall throughput similar to their level before Ancestral Guidance was removed.
    • Master of the Elements now lasts 30 seconds (was 15 seconds).
    • Farseer
      • All Ancestor healing now benefits from Mastery: Deep Healing.
      • All Ancestor healing reduced by 15%.
      • Ancestors now cast Healing Wave when the Shaman casts Healing Wave. Healing Wave heals for slightly more than Healing Surge.
      • Whispering Waves now also duplicates Healing Wave healing done by Ancestors.
      • Maelstrom Supremacy now increases the healing of Healing Wave, Healing Surge, Wellspring, Downpour, and Chain Heal by 15% (was 8%).
      • Elemental Reverb now increases Riptide healing by 10% (was 5%).
    • Totemic
      • Downpour now overrides Surging Totem for 22 seconds (was 12 seconds).

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Restoration Shaman

Q: How does
Earth Shield and
Chain Heal interact?

A: Only the target that has

Earth Shield gets the benefit of increased healing regardless if it's your initial
Chain Heal target or the last bounce
